text: Sir George Burrard, 3rd BaronetThe Baronetage became extinct in 1965 Burke's Peerage, 1967 p3099 (6 April 1769 - 17 May 1856Leigh Rayment) was a Church of England priest.Memorial plaque in St James's Church, Yarmouth Memorial to Sir George Burrard, 3rd Baronet in St James' Church, Yarmouth, Isle of Wight He was the second son of William Burrard and nephew of Sir Harry Burrard, 1st Baronet, of Walhampton and succeeded his brother as baronet in 1840.'Parishes: Boldre', A History of the County of Hampshire: Volume 4 (1911), pp. 616-623. URL: http://www.british-history.ac.uk/report.aspx?compid=56896 Date accessed: 22 May 2011 He was Chaplain in Ordinary to Queen Victoria for 38 years.Deaths Sir George Burrard The Times Tuesday, May 20, 1856; pg. 1; Issue 22372; col A == References == Category:1769 births Category:1856 deaths Category:19th- century English Anglican priests Category:Honorary Chaplains to the Queen Category:Knights Grand Cross of the Order of St Michael and St George Category:Knights Grand Cross of the Order of the Bath Category:Baronets in the Baronetage of Great Britain
title: Sir George Burrard, 3rd Baronet
